Please fix the error(s) in the configuration file. You can initialize chat with CodeRabbit to get help with the configuration file. > >
> üí• Parsing errors (1) > > ``` > duplicated mapping key in ".coderabbit.yaml" (20:1) > > 17 | language: en-US > 18 | > 19 | # Review settings > 20 | reviews: > ------^ > 21 | # Enable comprehensive code a ... > 22 | profile: chill > ``` > >

> ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration instructions > > - Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information. > - If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json` > >
## Walkthrough Adds documentation, CI/config and review artifacts; introduces a Tone.js audio subsystem, a new enemy base class and updated enemy/player AI and rendering, a visual effects manager and richer background renderer, and new spatial/spawn systems for enemy placement. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Docs & CI / Review data**
`README.md`, `docs/CODERABBIT_COMPLETE_GUIDE.md`, `.coderabbit.yaml`, `.github/workflows/coderabbit-fetch.yml`, `coderabbit-reviews/actionable-summary.json`, `.eslintcache` | Documentation and configuration additions: README note about CodeRabbit behavior; comprehensive CodeRabbit integration guide; coderabbit config enabling auto-review; GH Action to fetch actionable summary; new actionable-summary JSON dataset; ESLint cache file. No runtime code logic changes. | | **Audio subsystem**
`packages/core/src/audio/ToneAudioFacade.js` | New exported class `ToneAudioFacade` and exported singleton `toneAudio`: Tone.js-based audio subsystem with sample loading, multi-bus mixer, music scheduling, beat-sync, playback API (playSound, duck/unduck, start/stopMusic), speech integration, diagnostics, and dev fallbacks. | | **Entity core & enemies**
`packages/entities/src/BaseEnemy.js`, `packages/entities/src/Grunt.js`, `packages/entities/src/Rusher.js`, `packages/entities/src/Stabber.js`, `packages/entities/src/player.js` | Added `BaseEnemy` class (common enemy behavior, rendering, speech, damage, bullets). Major refactors to Grunt, Rusher, Stabber and player: centralized core imports, visual/AI/audio changes, ambient speech refactors, motion-trail and FX helpers, collision API addition (Grunt.checkCollision), player input/beat-driven shooting, defensive checks, and new getters/setters for player x/y. Several public signatures added/changed. | | **Visuals / Background**
`packages/fx/src/visualEffects.js`, `packages/systems/src/BackgroundRenderer.js` | New `VisualEffectsManager` (particle systems, explosions, auroras, bloom/chromatic effects) exported as default. BackgroundRenderer overhauled: layered parallax (distant_galaxies, far_stars, nebulae, cosmic_dust, medium_stars, close_debris, foreground_particles), new draw(p, cameraSystem) entry, and helper drawNoiseWave; imports aligned to core constants. | | **Spatial & spawn systems**
`packages/systems/src/SpatialHashGrid.js`, `packages/systems/src/SpawnSystem.js` | New `SpatialHashGrid` (uniform hash grid with neighbors and coneQuery) and `SpawnSystem` (level-aware, rate-limited, collision-checked enemy spawning with fallback spiral search and manual forceSpawn). | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant GameLoop participant SpawnSystem participant SpatialGrid participant EnemyFactory participant WindowState GameLoop->>SpawnSystem: tick(deltaTime) SpawnSystem->>SpawnSystem: update timers, compute spawn chance SpawnSystem->>SpatialGrid: neighbors(candidateX,candidateY) SpatialGrid-->>SpawnSystem: nearby objects alt spot valid SpawnSystem->>EnemyFactory: createEnemy(type, pos, player, audio) EnemyFactory-->>SpawnSystem: enemy SpawnSystem->>WindowState: push enemy to window.enemies else no valid spot after tries SpawnSystem->>SpawnSystem: spiral search fallback, clamp SpawnSystem->>EnemyFactory: createEnemy(...) SpawnSystem->>WindowState: push enemy end ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 5 (Critical) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~90 minutes > I‚Äôm a rabbit with a tinkering ear, > I hopped through audio, stars, and fear. > Docs, spawns, and enemies in a neat parade‚Äî > I left a guide, a cache, and code that played. üêá‚ú® ---
üìú Recent review details **Configuration used: CodeRabbit UI** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Free**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between c58b3e464bcfdf9f93c2fa579ce971292fa7b60f and 2e04ceecd44e5f2cc8acd04fe46bdd576aa37327.
üìí Files selected for processing (12) * `.coderabbit.yaml` (2 hunks) * `.github/workflows/coderabbit-fetch.yml` (1 hunks) * `packages/core/src/audio/ToneAudioFacade.js` (1 hunks) * `packages/entities/src/BaseEnemy.js` (1 hunks) * `packages/entities/src/Grunt.js` (12 hunks) * `packages/entities/src/Rusher.js` (7 hunks) * `packages/entities/src/Stabber.js` (19 hunks) * `packages/entities/src/player.js` (11 hunks) * `packages/fx/src/visualEffects.js` (1 hunks) * `packages/systems/src/BackgroundRenderer.js` (8 hunks) * `packages/systems/src/SpatialHashGrid.js` (1 hunks) * `packages/systems/src/SpawnSystem.js` (1 hunks)

## Walkthrough Monorepo restructure to a modular packages/* workspace, migrating core game loop, entities, FX, systems, audio, and tooling. Replaced legacy js/* with new modules, added Tone.js audio facade, event-bus-driven VFX, Playwright probe workflows, GitHub Issues tooling, CI workflows, dev server manager, docs overhaul, and configuration updates. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Repo config & ignore**
`package.json`, `.gitignore`, `.prettierrc`, `.eslintcache`, `.coderabbit.yaml`, `.cursor*`, `.env.example`, `.githooks/*` | Add workspace workspaces, new scripts and dev server controls, lint/format tweaks, broaden CodeRabbit reviews to all branches (`branches: "*"`) in `.coderabbit.yaml`, cursor rules/indexing, expanded env example, cross-platform pre-commit/pre-push hooks and ESLint cache. | | **CI/CD workflows**
`.github/workflows/*`, `.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md` | Add workflows for CI dev-server + probes, auto-changelog, auto-docs/cache refresh, context7 cache refresh; add PR checklist template. | | **Docs overhaul**
`README.md`, `docs/*`, `docs/archive/*` | Large documentation additions and rewrites: architecture (packages/), CodeRabbit guides, PRDs, testing/playwright guides, dev server workflow, roadmap, audit plans; remove/archive obsolete analyses. | | **HTML entry & test harnesses**
`index.html`, `audio-test.html`, `debug-test.html` | Local p5 load, import map for `@vibe/*` packages, consolidated package bootstrap; add audio and debug test pages. | | **Root deletions (legacy js/)**
`js/*`, `move-bug-reports.js`, legacy ticket API files | Remove legacy monolithic JS files (BeatClock, GameLoop, GameState, SpawnSystem, CollisionSystem, mathUtils, config, ticketManager, etc.) and old bug-report mover. | | **Core package (@vibe/core)**
`packages/core/*` | New core package: BeatClock, GameState, seeded mathUtils, config, fx tuning/palette, audio subsystem (ToneAudioFacade, SampleLoader, FallbackManager, MusicScheduler, SpeechCoordinator), fx exports, tests, and barrel. | | **Entities package (@vibe/entities)**
`packages/entities/*` | Add BaseEnemy, EnemyEventBus, AI/FX/speech utilities, entity implementations (Grunt, Rusher, Tank, Stabber) refactored to use `SOUND` constants and event-bus; bullet collision switched to squared-distance; package barrel and manifest. | | **FX package (@vibe/fx)**
`packages/fx/*` | Add VisualEffectsManager, VFXDispatcher, AdaptiveLODManager, EffectsProfiler, overlays, explosion refactor (dt-aware), palettes/config, remove legacy enhanced explosion manager; package barrel. | | **Systems package (@vibe/systems)**
`packages/systems/*` | Add CameraSystem, BombSystem, BackgroundRenderer overhaul, UIRenderer updates (audio-lab UI, GH Issues integration), package manifest and README. | | **Game orchestrator (@vibe/game)**
`packages/game/src/*` | New GameLoop (beat-synced), separated update/draw passes, restart/key handlers, side-effect entry barrel. | | **Tooling & probes (@vibe/tooling)**
`packages/tooling/src/*`, `packages/tooling/__tests__/*` | Add githubIssueManager, RemoteConsoleLogger, ErrorReporter; probes (liveness, audio-system, collision, comprehensive runner), probe runner, probe tests, tooling barrel and tests. | | **Dev scripts**
`scripts/dev-server.js`, `scripts/*` | New dev server manager CLI (start/stop/status/restart), docs cache/context7 scripts, doc-drift checker and other helper scripts. | | **ESLint config**
`eslint.config.js` | Expand ignore globs, add globals, set ecmaVersion: 'latest', enforce `no-undef`, restrict legacy audio imports. | | **CodeRabbit reviews data**
`coderabbit-reviews/*` | Add actionable summaries, autofix log and README artifacts for automated review processing. | | **Audio assets manifest**
`public/audio/manifest.json` | Add centralized audio manifest mapping sample IDs to CDN URLs. | | **PowerShell profile**
`.cursor.ps1` | Add developer PowerShell profile with bun-based task helpers and `vibe-status` checks for dev servers. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant IndexHTML participant Game as @vibe/game participant Core as @vibe/core participant Entities as @vibe/entities participant FX as @vibe/fx participant Systems as @vibe/systems participant Audio as ToneAudioFacade User->>IndexHTML: Load page IndexHTML->>Game: import and bootstrap Game->>Core: init BeatClock, GameState Game->>Systems: init Camera, Background, UI Game->>FX: init VisualEffectsManager + VFXDispatcher Game->>Entities: spawn player/enemies User-->>Audio: First gesture triggers init() Audio-->>Core: sync bpm with BeatClock loop Each frame Game->>Game: updatePass() Entities-->>FX: dispatch enemy events FX->>FX: VFXDispatcher routes to managers Game->>Game: drawPass() end ``` ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Enemy participant Bus as EnemyEventBus participant Dispatcher as VFXDispatcher participant VFX as VisualEffectsManager participant ScreenFX as EffectsManager Enemy->>Bus: emit ENEMY_HIT/KILLED/ARMOR_* Bus->>Dispatcher: window CustomEvent(detail) Dispatcher->>VFX: add spark/debris/explosion Dispatcher->>ScreenFX: shake/flash ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 5 (Critical) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~120+ minutes ## Poem > A rabbit taps the cosmic beat, hop-hop into the show, > Packages bloom like carrots ‚Äî core, entities, fx in a row. > Tone wakes up the music, event-bus makes sparks glow. > Probes sniff out the bugs while CI keeps the flow. > Hop on, push that branch ‚Äî may the green checks grow! --- > [!NOTE] >
> üéÅ Summarized by CodeRabbit Free > > Your organization is on the Free plan. CodeRabbit will generate a high-level summary and a walkthrough for each pull request. For a comprehensive line-by-line review, please upgrade your subscription to CodeRabbit Pro by visiting . > >

pr_title: Enhance visual effects management by initializing `EffectsManager` in `GameLoop.js`, updating particle effects rendering, and integrating linear interpolation function `lerp` in `mathUtils.js`. This improves visual fidelity and performance during gameplay. Additionally, refactor player shooting logic in `player.js` for better debugging and responsiveness.
body:
**Actionable comments posted: 36**
‚ôªÔ∏è Duplicate comments (5)
js/collision-detection-probe.js (3)
`5-5`: **Guard against missing `random` export** This issue was previously identified. The destructuring import can throw if `mathUtils.js` doesn't export `random`. Consider adding a fallback to `Math.random` as suggested in the previous review. --- `64-71`: **Collision checks mutate game state ‚Äì call them in a dry-run wrapper** This issue was previously identified. `checkBulletCollisions()` and `checkContactCollisions()` usually advance game logic (damage, removals). Invoking them during probe diagnostics may interfere with actual gameplay. Consider wrapping in a snapshot/rollback mechanism or using idempotent probe variants. --- `172-172`: **Replace deprecated `substr` and strengthen ID entropy** This issue was previously identified. `String.prototype.substr` is deprecated and should be replaced with `slice()`. Additionally, the ID entropy could be strengthened using `crypto.getRandomValues` when available.
js/comprehensive-probe-runner.js (2)
`56-56`: **Call the default export ‚Äì don't await the module object** `await probeModule.default` resolves to whatever the probe exports, not to the result of running the probe. If each probe exports a function, the current code silently stores the function itself in `result`, breaking downstream logic. --- `51-92`: **Run probes in parallel for improved performance** The probes are independent and running them sequentially increases startup time unnecessarily. Using `Promise.allSettled` would maintain error handling while improving performance.
üßπ Nitpick comments (78)
packages/tooling/src/index.js (1)
`4-4`: **Remove the useless empty export statement.** The empty export statement is unnecessary since there's another export in the file. ```diff -export {}; ```
docs/README.md (1)
`1-103`: **Excellent documentation structure with minor formatting improvements needed.** This comprehensive documentation index provides excellent organization and navigation for different user types. The categorization and status tracking are particularly helpful for maintaining documentation quality. However, address these minor formatting issues: ```diff ### For Testing -1. [MCP_PLAYWRIGHT_TESTING_GUIDE.md](./MCP_PLAYWRIGHT_TESTING_GUIDE.md) for automated testing +1. [MCP_PLAYWRIGHT_TESTING_GUIDE.md](./MCP_PLAYWRIGHT_TESTING_GUIDE.md) for automated testing. 2. [MCP_TOOLS_GUIDE.md](./MCP_TOOLS_GUIDE.md) for advanced automation -3. [TICKETING_SYSTEM_GUIDE.md](./TICKETING_SYSTEM_GUIDE.md) for bug reporting +3. [TICKETING_SYSTEM_GUIDE.md](./TICKETING_SYSTEM_GUIDE.md) for bug reporting. ### For Audio/Game Design -1. [DESIGN.md](./DESIGN.md) for game mechanics +1. [DESIGN.md](./DESIGN.md) for game mechanics. 2. [AUDIO_CONFIGURATION_GUIDE.md](./AUDIO_CONFIGURATION_GUIDE.md) for audio setup ```
scripts/setup-environment.bat (1)
`16-16`: **Security consideration: ExecutionPolicy Bypass.** Using `-ExecutionPolicy Bypass` circumvents PowerShell's execution policy security features. Consider documenting this requirement and the security implications in the script comments or project documentation. A plain function approach would be more appropriate and simpler. ```diff -export class DebugLogger { - /** - * Logs a message and optional error object to the .debug folder with a timestamp. - * @param {string} message - The debug or error message - * @param {Error|object} [err] - Optional error object for stack trace or details - */ - static log(message, err) { +/** + * Logs a message and optional error object to the .debug folder with a timestamp. + * @param {string} message - The debug or error message + * @param {Error|object} [err] - Optional error object for stack trace or details + */ +export function debugLog(message, err) { try { if (!existsSync(DEBUG_DIR)) { mkdirSync(DEBUG_DIR); } const now = new Date(); const dateStr = now.toISOString().slice(0, 10); // YYYY-MM-DD const timeStr = now.toISOString(); let logMsg = `[${timeStr}] ${message}`; if (err) { logMsg += `\n${err.stack || JSON.stringify(err)}`; } logMsg += '\n'; const logFile = join(DEBUG_DIR, `${dateStr}.log`); appendFileSync(logFile, logMsg, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { // Fallback: print to console if file logging fails console.log('‚ö†Ô∏è DebugLogger failed:', e); } - } -} +} ``` --- `39-39`: **Fix trailing whitespace.** ESLint detected trailing whitespace that should be removed. ```diff -} +} ```

_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_

**Security concern: Dynamic code execution with Invoke-Expression.**

Using `Invoke-Expression` with string interpolation poses security risks if project names aren't properly sanitized. A malicious project name could inject arbitrary PowerShell code.


Replace dynamic function generation with a safer approach:

```diff
-        $navFunction = "function global:$project { Set-Location \`"D:\projects\$project\`" }"
-        Invoke-Expression $navFunction
+        New-Item -Path Function: -Name "global:$project" -Value {
+            Set-Location "D:\projects\$($args[0])"
+        }.GetNewClosure() -Force
+        Set-Item -Path "Function:\global:$project" -Value (Get-Item "Function:\global:$project").ScriptBlock.InvokeWithContext($null, [psvariable]::new('project', $project))
```

Alternatively, use a command registry pattern:
```powershell
$Global:ProjectCommands[$functionName] = [scriptblock]::Create($cmdValue)
# Then invoke with: & $Global:ProjectCommands[$functionName]
```

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Consider specifying the full path to the PowerShell script.**

The script assumes `setup-windows-environment.ps1` is in the same directory. Consider using a relative path from the script's location to ensure it works regardless of the current working directory.



```diff
-powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File setup-windows-environment.ps1
+powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "%~dp0setup-windows-environment.ps1"
```

This ensures the script works when called from any directory by using `%~dp0` to get the script's directory path.

- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**CLI self-execution check is brittle on different paths**

`import.meta.url === \`file://${process.argv[1]}\`` fails when the script is invoked via a symlink or a relative path.

```diff
-import.meta.url === `file://${process.argv[1]}`
+import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';
+import path from 'path';
+
+fileURLToPath(import.meta.url) === path.resolve(process.argv[1])
```

This uses Node‚Äôs canonical file path and works regardless of how the program is launched.

**Suggestion text may be empty for some patterns**

`text: match[1] || match[0]` skips content when the first capture group is empty (e.g., ```suggestion``` blocks).  
Fallback to `match[0]` only if *all* capture groups are falsy:

```diff
-const suggestion = {
-  text: match[1] || match[0],
+const firstNonEmpty = match.slice(1).find(Boolean) || match[0];
+const suggestion = {
+  text: firstNonEmpty.trim(),
```

pr_title: Enhance visual effects management by initializing `EffectsManager` in `GameLoop.js`, updating particle effects rendering, and integrating linear interpolation function `lerp` in `mathUtils.js`. This improves visual fidelity and performance during gameplay. Additionally, refactor player shooting logic in `player.js` for better debugging and responsiveness.
body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Network calls run sequentially ‚Äì switch to `Promise.all` for 5-10√ó speed-up**

`fetchPullRequestReviews` and `fetchReviewComments` are awaited one-by-one inside the loop.  
For 10 PRs this doubles the round-trips.

```diff
-for (const pr of prs) {
-  const reviews = await this.fetchPullRequestReviews(pr.number);
-  const comments = await this.fetchReviewComments(pr.number);
+await Promise.all(
+  prs.map(async (pr) => {
+    const [reviews, comments] = await Promise.all([
+      this.fetchPullRequestReviews(pr.number),
+      this.fetchReviewComments(pr.number)
+    ]);
   ...
-}
+  })
+);
```

The logic stays the same but latency drops dramatically.

```suggestion
        await Promise.all(

                reviewUrl: review.html_url,

                state: review.state,
                submittedAt: review.submitted_at,
                comments: comments.filter(
                  (c) => c.pull_request_review_id === review.id
                )
              };
    
              // Analyze the review content
              const analysis = this.analyzeReview(processedReview);
              processedReview.analysis = analysis;
    
              allReviews.push(processedReview);
            }
          })
        );
```

_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_

**Unify the module system ‚Äí don‚Äôt mix ESM `import` with CommonJS `require`**  

The file is authored as an ES-module (top‚Äìlevel `import` statements). Later sections fallback to `require(...)`, which will raise `ReferenceError: require is not defined` when this file is executed by Node in ESM mode. Import the built-ins with regular `import` once at the top and reuse them everywhere.

```diff
+import path from 'path';
```

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Dynamic `import('fs')` returns a namespace object ‚Äì the subsequent property access is wrong**  

`const fs = await import('fs');` yields `{ default: [Object] }`.  
`fs.existsSync` and `fs.readFileSync` will therefore be `undefined`, crashing at runtime.

Either use the proposed top-level import (see previous comment) or destructure the default:

```diff
-const fs = await import('fs');
-const path = await import('path');
+const { default: fs } = await import('fs');
+const { default: path } = await import('path');
```



<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
            const { default: fs } = await import('fs');
            const { default: path } = await import('path');
            const ticketsPath = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tests', 'bug-reports', 'coderabbit-tickets.json');
            
            if (!fs.existsSync(ticketsPath)) {
                return null;
            }

            const ticketsData = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(ticketsPath, 'utf8'));
```

_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_

**Captured text drops the description part of ‚Äú**Title**‚Äù suggestions**

For the first regex two capture-groups are defined, but later you keep only `match[1]`:

```js
{ regex: /\*\*([^*]+)\*\*\s*\n\n([^`]+)/g, type: 'general' }
```

This returns the bold header but omits the explanatory paragraph in `match[2]`, so the suggestion text becomes too terse.

```diff
-const text = match[1] || match[0];
+const text = (match[2] ?? match[1] ?? match[0]).trim();
```

That preserves the useful context without breaking the other patterns.

**Replace deprecated `substr` and strengthen ID entropy**

`String.prototype.substr` is deprecated. Also, converting a float to base-36 drastically trims entropy (e.g., ‚Äú0.a3f‚Ä¶‚Äù). Use `crypto.getRandomValues` when available, else `Math.random`, and `slice()`.

```diff
+ ).slice(0, 8);
```

_üí° Verification agent_

<details>
<summary>üß© Analysis chain</summary>

**Timing-health calculation may report false positives**

`lastBeatTime`‚Äôs unit (ms vs Date object) isn‚Äôt validated. If it‚Äôs a `Date`, subtracting yields `NaN`. Also, flagging any delay > 2√ó interval as ‚Äúcritical failure‚Äù may spam tickets when the game is paused or tabbed out. Consider:

1. Normalising `lastBeatTime` to a timestamp (`Number(lastBeatTime)` or `lastBeatTime.getTime()`).
2. Treating document `visibilityState === "hidden"` or `!beatClock.isActive` as ‚Äúskippable‚Äù instead of critical.

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
#!/bin/bash
# Locate where lastBeatTime is defined/assigned to determine its type
rg -n "lastBeatTime" -n .

# Check if beatClock.isActive is ever used or defined for skippable logic
rg -n "beatClock\.isActive" -n .
```

Length of output: 488

---



</details>

**Improve beat timing health check for unit consistency and inactive state**

The current logic in js/audio-system-probe.js (lines 90‚Äì101) may throw NaN or emit critical failures when the page is hidden or audio is paused.

‚Ä¢ Normalize lastBeatTime to a number when assigning:
```diff
- result.beatClock.lastBeatTime = window.beatClock.lastBeatTime || null;
+ const rawLastBeat = window.beatClock.lastBeatTime;
+ result.beatClock.lastBeatTime = rawLastBeat
+   ? (typeof rawLastBeat === 'number'
+       ? rawLastBeat
+       : rawLastBeat.getTime())
+   : null;
```
‚Ä¢ Guard the timing check by skipping when the tab is hidden or audio is inactive:
```diff
- if (result.beatClock.lastBeatTime) {
+ if (
+   result.beatClock.lastBeatTime &&
+   document.visibilityState === 'visible' &&
+   result.beatClock.isActive
+ ) {
    const timeSinceLastBeat = Date.now() - result.beatClock.lastBeatTime;
    const expectedBeatInterval = result.beatClock.bpm
      ? 60000 / result.beatClock.bpm
      : 1000;
    result.beatClock.beatTimingHealthy = timeSinceLastBeat
      < expectedBeatInterval * 2;

    if (!result.beatClock.beatTimingHealthy) {
      result.warnings.push(
        'Beat timing appears unhealthy ‚Äì too long since last beat'
      );
      result.criticalFailures.push('BeatClock timing unhealthy');
    }
}
```

These changes ensure subtraction won‚Äôt yield NaN and avoid spamming failures when the audio system is legitimately paused or the page is hidden.

This improves visual fidelity and performance during gameplay. Additionally, refactor player shooting logic in `player.js` for better debugging and responsiveness.
body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Run probes in parallel for a 3-4√ó speed-up**

The probes are independent; awaiting them one-by-one stretches startup by N√óprobe latency.  
A trivial refactor with `Promise.allSettled` keeps the same error semantics while shaving seconds off large suites.

```diff
- for (const probe of probes) {
-   try {
-     ‚Ä¶
-   } catch (error) { ‚Ä¶ }
- }
+ const probeResults = await Promise.allSettled(
+   probes.map(async (probe) => {
+     console.log(`üîç Running ${probe.name} probe: ${probe.description}`);
+     const mod = await import(probe.module);
+     return { probe, result: await (typeof mod.default === 'function' ? mod.default() : mod.default) };
+   })
+ );
+
+ for (const {status, value, reason} of probeResults) {
```

pr_title: Enhance visual effects management by initializing `EffectsManager` in `GameLoop.js`, updating particle effects rendering, and integrating linear interpolation function `lerp` in `mathUtils.js`. This improves visual fidelity and performance during gameplay. Additionally, refactor player shooting logic in `player.js` for better debugging and responsiveness.
body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_

**Call the default export ‚Äì don‚Äôt await the module object**

`await probeModule.default` resolves to whatever the probe *exports*, not to the **result** of running the probe.  
If each probe exports a function (typical), the current code silently stores the function itself in `result`, breaking downstream logic (e.g. `result.failure`).  

```diff
- const result = await probeModule.default;
+ const result =
+   typeof probeModule.default === 'function'
+     ? await probeModule.default()      // run the probe
+     : await probeModule.default;       // allow promise/obj fall-through
```



<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
          const probeModule = await import(probe.module);
-         const result = await probeModule.default;
+         const result =
+           typeof probeModule.default === 'function'
+             ? await probeModule.default()      // run the probe
+             : await probeModule.default;       // allow promise/obj fall-through
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

```
In js/comprehensive-probe-runner.js around lines 43 to 45, the code incorrectly
awaits the default export of the imported module instead of calling it. To fix
this, remove the await from `probeModule.default` and instead call the default
export as a function with parentheses, then await the result of that function
call. This ensures `result` holds the outcome of running the probe, not the
function itself.
```

<!-- walkthrough_start -->

## Walkthrough

This update migrates the Vibe game codebase to a modular, package-based architecture. Legacy core modules (game loop, state, timing, collision, spawning, config, ticketing, etc.) are replaced by new equivalents in `@vibe/core`, `@vibe/entities`, `@vibe/systems`, `@vibe/fx`, and `@vibe/tooling`. The migration includes refactoring imports, modularizing systems, centralizing configuration, enhancing audio and effects, improving error handling, and updating documentation, tests, and scripts to align with the new structure.

## Changes

| File(s) / Path(s)                                          | Summary of Changes                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| js/BeatClock.js, js/CollisionSystem.js, js/GameState.js, js/SpawnSystem.js, js/config.js, js/ticketManager.js, ticketManager.js, run-mcp-tests.js | **Deleted:** Legacy core modules for timing, collision, state, spawning, config, and ticketing removed in favor of new modular implementations.                                                     |
| js/GameLoop.js                                             | Refactored to use modular imports from `@vibe` packages, added profiler overlay, music manager, adaptive LOD, and system modularization; global synchronization and debugging enhancements.         |
| js/mathUtils.js                                            | Added `lerp` linear interpolation utility with JSDoc; other math utilities now reside in `packages/core`.                                                                                           |
| js/ai-liveness-probe.js                                    | Updated import paths and made property accesses safer using optional chaining and nullish coalescing.                                                                                              |
| js/audio-system-probe.js, js/collision-detection-probe.js, js/comprehensive-probe-runner.js | **Added:** New probe modules for audio, collision, and comprehensive system health checks; includes ticket auto-reporting and diagnostic logging.                                                   |
| index.html                                                 | Replaced individual script imports with an import map and consolidated bootstrap; modularized script loading using new packages.                                                                   |
| packages/core/**, packages/entities/**, packages/systems/**, packages/fx/**, packages/tooling/** | **Added:** New modular packages for core logic, entities, systems, effects, and developer tooling; includes new configs, utilities, and barrel files.                                               |
| packages/core/src/Audio.js                                 | Integrated SFXManager, category gain, sound registry validation, and event-driven player reference updates; improved sound effect handling.                                                         |
| packages/core/src/BeatClock.js, packages/core/src/GameState.js | **Added:** New modular implementations for musical timing and global game state management.                                                                                                         |
| packages/core/src/TicketCore.js, packages/tooling/src/ticketManager.js, packages/tooling/src/ticket-cli.js | **Added:** Centralized ticket management logic for file and API workflows, CLI tool, and browser-compatible manager with caching and validation.                                                    |
| packages/core/src/config.js, packages/core/src/fxConfig.js, packages/core/src/fxPalette.js | **Added:** Centralized configuration for environment, audio, and effects parameters.                                                                                                                |
| packages/core/src/audio/MusicManager.js, packages/core/src/audio/SFXManager.js, packages/core/src/audio/SoundIds.js | **Added:** Modular music and sound effect managers; centralized sound ID registry.                                                                           |
| packages/entities/src/EnemyAIUtils.js, EnemyFXUtils.js, EnemySpeechUtils.js | **Added:** Shared AI, FX, and speech utilities to eliminate duplication across enemy types.                                                                                                         |
| packages/entities/src/player.js, Grunt.js, Rusher.js, Stabber.js, Tank.js, bullet.js | Updated to use modular math/audio utilities, centralized sound IDs, and shared helpers; improved rhythm-locked shooting and optimized collision checks.                                             |
| packages/fx/src/effects.js, effectsConfig.js, explosions/Explosion.js, explosions/ExplosionManager.js, explosions/PlasmaCloud.js, explosions/RadioactiveDebris.js, visualEffects.js | Refactored to use modular math, centralized config/palette, frame-rate independence, and enhanced profiling; improved effect efficiency and consistency.         |
| packages/fx/src/AdaptiveLODManager.js, EffectsProfiler.js, ProfilerOverlay.js | **Added:** Adaptive level-of-detail manager, lightweight effects profiler, and in-game profiler overlay.                                                                                            |
| packages/systems/src/BackgroundRenderer.js, CameraSystem.js, SpawnSystem.js, CollisionSystem.js, BulletSystem.js, BombSystem.js, InputSystem.js, UIRenderer.js, TestMode.js | **Added/Refactored:** Modular system classes for rendering, camera, spawning, collision, bullets, bombs, input, UI, and test mode; improved performance and maintainability. |
| packages/systems/src/UIRenderer.js                         | Inlined ticket API functions, enhanced key event handling for test/debug features.                                                                                                                 |
| packages/tooling/src/DebugLogger.js, RemoteConsoleLogger.js, errorHandler.js | **Added:** Debug logger for persistent logs, remote console logger, and enhanced error handling utilities.                                                                                          |
| ticket-api.js                                              | Refactored to use async dynamic imports of `TicketCore` for all ticket operations; added remote debug logging and CORS.                                                                            |
| package.json, playwright.config.js, .env.example, .gitignore, .prettierrc, eslint.config.js | Updated for workspace support, new scripts, dependency updates, Playwright config, environment variables, ignore rules, and linting standards.                                                     |
| docs/**, README.md, .cursorrules, scripts/**, tests/**     | Documentation expanded, new guides and migration notes added, PowerShell and batch scripts introduced, test files updated for modular structure and enhanced logging.                               |

## Sequence Diagram(s)

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Browser
    participant GameLoop
    participant Core as @vibe/core
    participant Entities as @vibe/entities
    participant Systems as @vibe/systems
    participant FX as @vibe/fx
    participant Tooling as @vibe/tooling

    Browser->>Tooling: setupRemoteConsoleLogger()
    Browser->>Core: import { GameState, BeatClock, Audio, MusicManager }
    Browser->>Entities: import { Player, Bullet, Enemies }
    Browser->>Systems: import { CameraSystem, SpawnSystem, CollisionSystem, BulletSystem, BombSystem, InputSystem }
    Browser->>FX: import { EffectsManager, VisualEffectsManager, ProfilerOverlay }
    Browser->>GameLoop: start()
    GameLoop->>Core: setup(p)
    GameLoop->>Entities: initialize Player, Enemies, Bullets
    GameLoop->>Systems: initialize Camera, Spawn, Collision, Input
    GameLoop->>FX: initialize Effects, VisualEffects
    GameLoop->>Core: initialize Audio, MusicManager
    loop Each Frame
        GameLoop->>Systems: InputSystem.update()
        GameLoop->>Systems: BulletSystem.update()
        GameLoop->>Systems: BombSystem.update()
        GameLoop->>Systems: CollisionSystem.checkBulletCollisions()
        GameLoop->>FX: EffectsManager.update()
        GameLoop->>FX: VisualEffectsManager.update()
        GameLoop->>Core: MusicManager.update()
        GameLoop->>FX: ProfilerOverlay.draw()
    end
```

## Walkthrough

This update introduces a new developer server setup guide and reorganizes testing documentation. It enhances audio with a beat-synced tremolo effect, updates player voice and dialogue, adds a parallax foreground sparks layer, improves bullet collision detection, and refines shooting cooldown logic. The rusher charge sound is synchronized with the beat clock. Legacy automated tests are replaced by Playwright gameplay probes, and CI workflows and scripts are updated accordingly.

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=edwardfalk/vibe&utm_content=13):

- Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:
  - `I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>, please review it.`
  - `Explain this complex logic.`
  - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.`
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai explain this code block.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and explain its main purpose.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

### Support

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR.

## Walkthrough

This update introduces a new quickstart guide for local development and testing, enhances the game's audio and visual effects, improves collision detection accuracy, and refines UI feedback. It also updates automated test infrastructure and documentation, with several internal logic and rendering improvements across gameplay and testing scripts.

## Changes

| File(s)                                             | Change Summary |
|-----------------------------------------------------|---------------|
| README.md, docs/DEV_SERVER_SETUP.md                 | Added a documentation entry and a new quickstart guide for local dev server setup and automated testing. |
| index.html                                          | Added CSS to hide the mouse cursor over the canvas. |
| js/Audio.js                                         | Added beat-synced tremolo effect for rusher charge sound, adjusted player voice config, and updated player dialogue lines. |
| js/BackgroundRenderer.js                            | Added a new "foreground_sparks" parallax layer with animated spark effects. |
| js/BaseEnemy.js                                     | Health bar now only draws if the enemy is not marked for removal. |
| js/GameLoop.js                                      | Linked player to camera system for mouse aiming and ensured bullet collisions are checked earlier in the update cycle. |
| js/Rusher.js                                        | Rusher charge sound now conditionally plays based on beat clock state and uses a new sound method. |
| js/UIRenderer.js                                    | Added a red crosshair overlay during gameplay via a new method. |
| js/bullet.js                                        | Improved bullet collision detection using segment intersection and previous position tracking. |
| js/player.js                                        | Added visual "mysterious eyes" and "cosmic horns" to the player sprite. |
| mcp-automated-test-runner.js                        | Ensured test-results directory exists before saving reports. |
| run-mcp-tests.js                                    | Refactored mock test client to provide scenario-specific responses for various test cases. |

## Sequence Diagram(s)

```mermaid
    participant Server as Local Dev Server
```

```mermaid
    end
```

## Walkthrough

This update introduces a new quickstart guide for local development and testing, enhances the audio system with a beat-synced tremolo effect, improves bullet collision detection, adds new visual features to the player, adjusts enemy health bar rendering, refines test runner and mocking logic for automated tests, adds a parallax foreground sparks layer, hides the mouse cursor over the canvas, links the player to the camera system, and adds a crosshair UI element during gameplay.

## Changes

| File(s)                                   | Change Summary                                                                                          |
|------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| README.md, docs/DEV_SERVER_SETUP.md      | Added a new quickstart guide for local dev server setup and referenced it in the documentation map.   |
| js/Audio.js                              | Added beat-synced tremolo effect to rusher charge sound, updated player voice config and dialogue lines, and introduced `applyBeatTremolo` method. |
| js/BaseEnemy.js                          | Health bar now only draws for active (non-removal) enemies.                                           |
| js/Rusher.js                             | Charge sound now plays conditionally based on beat clock state and uses a dedicated method.           |
| js/bullet.js                            | Improved bullet collision detection using segment-based distance and tracks previous bullet position. |
| js/player.js                            | Added mysterious eyes and cosmic horns to the player's head drawing.                                  |
| mcp-automated-test-runner.js            | Ensures `test-results` directory exists before saving test reports.                                   |
| run-mcp-tests.js                        | MockMCPClient's `evaluate` method now returns context-specific mock responses based on script content.|
| index.html                             | Added CSS to hide mouse cursor over the canvas element.                                               |
| js/BackgroundRenderer.js                | Added new parallax foreground sparks layer with flickering spark elements.                            |
| js/GameLoop.js                         | Linked player instance to global camera system for mouse aiming.                                      |
| js/UIRenderer.js                       | Added crosshair drawing method and integrated it into UI rendering during gameplay.                   |

## Sequence Diagram(s)

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Game
    participant Audio
    participant BeatClock

    Game->>Audio: playRusherCharge(x, y)
    alt BeatClock exists and canRusherCharge()
        Audio->>Audio: playTone({tremolo: true}, x, y)
        Audio->>BeatClock: get BPM
        Audio->>Audio: applyBeatTremolo(gainNode, duration)
    else BeatClock not present
        Audio->>Audio: playTone({tremolo: true}, x, y)
    end
```

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Bullet
    participant Target

    Bullet->>Bullet: update()
    Bullet->>Bullet: save prevX, prevY
    Bullet->>Bullet: move to new x, y

    Bullet->>Bullet: checkCollision(target)
    Bullet->>Bullet: _pointSegmentDistance(target.x, target.y, prevX, prevY, x, y)
    alt distance < threshold
        Bullet->>Target: register hit
    end
```

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.

- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

## Walkthrough

This update introduces centralized randomness handling by replacing all direct uses of `Math.random()` with a custom `random()` function across the codebase. It also adds configuration files for ESLint and Prettier, updates documentation and environment setup, and enhances the bug report mover script to ensure the Downloads directory exists before use.

## Changes

| File(s)                                                                 | Change Summary                                                                                                                      |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| .env.example, js/config.js                                              | Added `GOOGLE_CLOUD_TTS_API_KEY` placeholder and switched config to use environment variable for API key.                           |
| .prettierrc, eslint.config.js, package.json, README.md                  | Added Prettier and ESLint configs, updated scripts for linting/formatting, and improved documentation for coding/testing standards. |
| js/Audio.js, js/EnemyFactory.js, js/UIRenderer.js, js/effects.js        | Replaced all `Math.random()` and Math functions with imports from `mathUtils.js` for centralized randomness/math utilities.         |
| js/ai-liveness-probe.js, js/audio-system-probe.js, js/combat-collision-probe.js, js/enemy-ai-probe.js, js/ui-score-probe.js         | Replaced `Math.random()` with imported `random()` for ticket ID generation in probe scripts.                                       |
| js/coderabbit-testing-integration.js, js/extended-gameplay-test.js, js/enhanced-edge-exploration-test.js, js/interactive-gameplay-test.js | Replaced all uses of `Math.random()` with custom `random()` in testing and integration scripts.                                    |
| move-bug-reports.js                                                     | Ensures Downloads directory exists before moving bug reports.                                                                       |

## Sequence Diagram(s)

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant App as Application Modules
    participant MathUtils as mathUtils.js

    App->>MathUtils: random()
    MathUtils-->>App: random value

    Note over App: All randomness now flows through mathUtils.js
```

## Poem

> In a warren of code, the rabbits decree,  
> "Let randomness flow from one place, not three!"  
> With Prettier and ESLint, the styles align,  
> And bug reports hop to their folders just fine.  
> Now with configs and docs, the project feels bright‚Äî  
> A carrot of order, a coder's delight! ü•ï

<!-- walkthrough_end -->

## Walkthrough

The changes replace all uses of p5.js's random and floor functions in several modules with custom utility functions (`random`, `randomRange`, `floor`) imported from a new `mathUtils.js` module. This affects randomness in audio, background rendering, enemy behavior, and camera shake, ensuring consistent random number generation across the codebase. Additionally, a tremolo effect was added to audio tones, a new parallax sparks layer was introduced, bullet collision detection was improved, a crosshair was drawn during gameplay, and other enhancements and fixes were made including new testing utilities and documentation.

## Changes

| File(s)                               | Change Summary                                                                                                                          |
|-------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| js/Audio.js                        | Replaced p5.js random/floor with `random`, `randomRange`, `floor` from `mathUtils.js`; added tremolo effect in `playTone`; updated voice and sound logic; added `applyBeatTremolo` method. |
| js/BackgroundRenderer.js            | Replaced p5.js random with custom random utils; added new parallax layer "foreground_sparks" with flickering sparks; added `drawForegroundSparks` method. |
| js/BaseEnemy.js                    | Replaced p5.js random with `randomRange` from `mathUtils.js`; prevented health bar drawing if enemy marked for removal.                |
| js/CameraSystem.js                 | Replaced p5.js random with `randomRange` for screen shake offsets.                                                                       |
| js/mathUtils.js                   | Added new exported function `randomRange(min, max)` for random floating-point numbers in a range.                                        |
| automated-game-test.js             | Added `checkScreenshots` function to verify PNG screenshots presence; integrated into test runner exit code logic; exported new function.|
| docs/DEV_SERVER_SETUP.md           | Added new documentation file with dev server setup and automated testing quickstart guide.                                              |
| index.html                       | Added CSS to hide mouse cursor over the canvas element.                                                                                  |
| js/GameLoop.js                   | Linked player‚Äôs cameraSystem reference to global cameraSystem to fix mouse aiming.                                                       |
| js/Rusher.js                     | Added conditional beat-synced gating for rusher charge sound playback using `window.beatClock`; changed method to `playRusherCharge`.  |
| js/UIRenderer.js                 | Added `drawCrosshair` method to draw red crosshair at mouse position; called during gameplay in `drawUI`.                               |
| js/bullet.js                    | Improved collision detection by tracking previous bullet position; collision uses point-to-segment distance; adjusted collision threshold.|
| js/player.js                    | Added mysterious eyes and small cosmic horns graphics to player head during drawing.                                                    |
| mcp-automated-test-runner.js     | Ensured existence of `test-results` directory before saving test report JSON file.                                                      |
| run-mcp-tests.js                | Refined `MockMCPClient.evaluate` to return specific mock responses based on script content for better test simulation.                  |
| js/TestMode.js                  | Replaced global width/height with `this.player.p.width`/`height` for player and enemy positioning.                                       |

This update introduces a comprehensive suite of automated testing, debugging, and code review integration tools for the Vibe game project. Extensive documentation, bug reports, and configuration files support a robust, modular, and automated development workflow.

<details>
<summary>ü™ß Tips</summary>

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=edwardfalk/vibe&utm_content=2):

- Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:
  - `I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>, please review it.`
  - `Explain this complex logic.`
  - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.`
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai explain this code block.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and explain its main purpose.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

### Support

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate sequence diagram` to generate a sequence diagram of the changes in this PR.
- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

```diff
+        const margin = 50;
+        return {
+            left: margin,
+            right: canvas.width - margin,
+            top: margin,
+            bottom: canvas.height - margin
+        };
+    }
+    // Fallback to defaults
+    return {
+        left: 50,
+        right: 1230,
+        top: 50,
```

**Update velocity prediction to use actual FPS from p5.js**  

Rather than assuming 60 FPS (and referencing an undefined `window.gameLoop.fps`), pull the real frame rate from p5.js (global or instance mode) and fall back to 60 only if unavailable:  

‚Ä¢ In js/edge-exploration-test.js around lines 250‚Äì256:  
```diff
                 if (targetEnemy.velocity) {
                     const predictionTime = 0.3; // 300ms prediction
-                    // Use actual delta time if available, otherwise assume 60fps
-                    const fps = window.gameLoop?.fps || 60;
+                    // Get actual FPS from p5.js (global or instance mode), default to 60
+                    const fps = typeof window.frameRate === 'function'
+                        ? window.frameRate()
+                        : window.p5?.instance?.frameRate() ?? 60;
                     predictedX += targetEnemy.velocity.x * predictionTime * fps;
                     predictedY += targetEnemy.velocity.y * predictionTime * fps;
                 }
```  

This aligns with the game‚Äôs use of p5.js (`window.p5.instance.frameRate()`) and avoids referencing nonexistent globals.

`97-118`: **Sequential file I/O slows the probe ‚Äì scan concurrently** `scanFileForCommentMarkers` is awaited inside a `for ‚Ä¶ of` loop. With many files the probe will grow linearly slower. Running the scans in parallel is trivial and safe: ```diff - let totalMarkers = 0; - const fileResults = []; - - for (const file of testFiles) { - const markers = await this.scanFileForCommentMarkers(file); - totalMarkers += markers.length; - - fileResults.push({ file, markers: markers.length, details: markers }); - } + const perFile = await Promise.all( + testFiles.map(f => this.scanFileForCommentMarkers(f) + .then(m => ({ file: f, markers: m.length, details: m }))) + ); + const totalMarkers = perFile.reduce((sum, r) => sum + r.markers, 0); + const fileResults = perFile; ``` Speeds the probe noticeably while preserving logic. --- `293-329`: **Path resolution & non-existent files** `readFile(filePath)` will throw if the caller‚Äôs CWD differs from repo root or the file is renamed. Resolve the path relative to repository root and fail early when the path is missing to avoid misleading ‚Äú0 markers‚Äù. ```diff - const fs = require('fs').promises; - const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, 'utf8'); + const fs = require('fs').promises; + const path = require('path'); + const abs = path.resolve(process.cwd(), filePath); + const content = await fs.readFile(abs, 'utf8'); ``` You already catch errors later; resolving the path eliminates the common ‚ÄúENOENT‚Äù confusion.

## Walkthrough

This update introduces a comprehensive overhaul of the Vibe game's testing, debugging, and automation infrastructure. It adds advanced automated test suites, interactive gameplay testers, edge exploration and survival tests, AI-powered probes, debugging tools, and robust integration with ticketing and CodeRabbit review systems. Core game modules are refactored for modularity and dependency injection, with improvements in timing, audio, rendering, and input systems. Extensive documentation, bug reports, and implementation summaries are included to support the new workflows.

## Changes

| File(s) / Path(s)                                                                 | Change Summary                                                                                                                      |
|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| .coderabbit.yaml, .cursorrules, .github/workflows/coderabbit-review.yml           | Added/rewrote configuration files for CodeRabbit review, coding standards, and GitHub Actions workflow integration.                 |
| COMPREHENSIVE_CODE_AUDIT_REPORT.md, COMPREHENSIVE_TESTING_SUMMARY.md, ...         | Added extensive audit, testing, debugging, and evaluation reports documenting system health, test results, and recommendations.      |
| MANUAL_TESTING_GUIDE.md                                                           | Removed legacy manual testing guide.                                                                                                |
| README.md                                                                         | Rewritten and expanded to serve as a comprehensive project overview and documentation hub.                                          |
| automated-game-test.js, run-mcp-tests.js, mcp-automated-test-runner.js            | Added/updated automated test runners for Node.js and MCP Playwright integration.                                                    |
| docs/*                                                                            | Added/updated guides for audio config, design, gameplay testing, MCP tools, Playwright, ticketing, and vision documents.            |
| index.html                                                                        | Added UI instructions and script inclusions for new test modules and AI monitoring tools.                                           |
| js/Audio.js, js/BackgroundRenderer.js, js/BaseEnemy.js, js/EnemyFactory.js, ...   | Refactored core modules for dependency injection, timing normalization, and modular architecture; updated constructor signatures.    |
| js/comprehensive-test-suite.js, js/interactive-gameplay-test.js, ...              | Added new automated and interactive test suites, edge exploration, enhanced survival, and AI liveness probes.                       |
| js/mathUtils.js                                                                   | Added new `dist` function and expanded math utilities for consistency and reuse across modules.                                      |
| js/game-debugging-probe.js, js/coderabbit-review-processor.js, ...                | Introduced debugging probes, CodeRabbit review processing, and testing integration modules.                                          |
| js/bullet.js, js/explosions/Explosion.js, js/explosions/ExplosionManager.js       | Updated for modular color handling, math function imports, and p5.js instance mode compliance.                                       |
| js/player.js, js/TestMode.js, js/UIRenderer.js                                    | Refactored for injected dependencies, improved input handling, and modular UI management.                                           |

<details>
<summary>ü™ß Tips</summary>

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=edwardfalk/vibe&utm_content=1):

- Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:
  - `I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>, please review it.`
  - `Explain this complex logic.`
  - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.`
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai explain this code block.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and explain its main purpose.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

### Support

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate sequence diagram` to generate a sequence diagram of the changes in this PR.
- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>
